page.title: 19RECREATION. PIGEONS.
page.content: My Dad races{Homing pigeons.}Every week from April to September he races them. A man in the village near us also races them. Another man keeps some but does not race them. The pigeons eat wheat, barley, maize, peas, beans, millet and "Homoform". On a night we take our pigeons up to the the pub where we basket them. When we basket pigeons we put a rubber ring on the pigeons leg. When they have raced back we put the rubbers in a special clock. Then at 8pm the clock is struck and Mum, the Club secretary, works out the placings for the race. We have about 20 members. On Wednesdays we basket the pigeons to go to Saintes in France, on Thursdays for Nantes, Cherbourg, Rennes in France and on Fridays to Swainswick, Weymouth, Wincanton, Exmouth, Plymouth and Penzance.
